content.raw:
I would like to use the robot\_pose\_from\_artifact\_origin service to align the map frame with the artifact report frame, as well as to locate the entrance to the tunnel to give a move\_base goal before starting the wall following behavior.

When I run it like this:

rosservice call /subt/pose\_from\_artifact\_origin "robot\_name: data: 'X1'"

I get 

ERROR: service \[/subt/pose\_from\_artifact\_origin\] responded with an error:

On the ignition gazebo window I see this:

\[Err\] \[[GameLogicPlugin.cc:658](http://GameLogicPlugin.cc:658)\] \[GameLogicPlugin\]: Unable to find the staging area \[BaseStation\]. Ignoring PoseFromArtifact request

Looking through the other information printed out while loading ignition, it looks like the base station might be called “base\_station” instead of “BaseStation”
content.html:
I would like to use the robot_pose_from_artifact_origin service to align the map frame with the artifact report frame, as well as to locate the entrance to the tunnel to give a move_base goal before starting the wall following behavior.

When I run it like this:

rosservice call /subt/pose_from_artifact_origin "robot_name: data: 'X1'"

I get

ERROR: service [/subt/pose_from_artifact_origin] responded with an error:

On the ignition gazebo window I see this:

[Err] [GameLogicPlugin.cc:658] [GameLogicPlugin]: Unable to find the staging area [BaseStation]. Ignoring PoseFromArtifact request

Looking through the other information printed out while loading ignition, it looks like the base station might be called “base_station” instead of “BaseStation”
